intro: Lotononis vexillata, commonly known as the Cape violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Lotononis vexillata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
